title: Detect applications dangerosity
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body:
Use their category to detect if it makes sense to use each rights (no problem if a GPS application access to the position, but it's a problem if a game want it).

Maybe use this library: [Android Market API](http://code.google.com/p/android-market-api/).

title: Match preference screen with Android recommendations
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The summary of each preference must display the state of the option.
For exemple, on the "Show system applications" preference, the summary must be "System applications will be shown" if the box is checked, and "System applications won't be shown" if not.

title: Update dev/release codes
body:
Odd version codes will be development versions, and even version codes will be released version.
If a version is in a development state, the version name will end with a beta letter (β).

title: Limit application icon width
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
With some applications (like [Wireless Tether](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=android.tether), when icon has a bigger width than height, it can exceed the width of the other applications.
Fix it by limiting icon width with the same as the height.

title: Add about popup
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body: Add a popup to describe project authors, release notes…

title: Hide system applications
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body: Add an option to permit to the user to hide system applications

title: Live alert
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Keep application in memory and live alert the user if an application is dangerous just after he installed it.

title: Remove an application
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Add a button in the application information view to remove this application.

title: Add an information view for applications
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body:
An information screen will be displayed when the user click on an application in the list.
This will contain useful informations about permissions asked by the application.

title: Add a tablet specific view
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body: Levels on the left of the screen, applications on the right, that's all.

title: Display levels using ExpandableLists
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: See all applications in one view!

title: Add levels of alerts
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body: Levels can be "Dangerous", "Keep an eye on" and "No perms" (this last list applications that don't need any permission, to prevent an application to use security flaw).

title: Default configurations
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Add default pre-configurated score algorithms, like "security paranoid", "I don't like big lists" or "security, what's that?".

title: Display score in applications list
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: The user have to see the score of each dangerous application.

title: Personalize score calculation algorithm
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: The user must be able to change values of each permission and the score to reach to set application as dangerous.

title: Add French translation
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body: The application have to be translated in French.

title: Choose dangerous applications sorting
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body:
User must have to choice to sort by applications names or by applications notes.
He can change his setting in the preference activity.
Default value is to sort them by names.

title: Class dangerous applications
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body: Applications list have to be displayed in a alphabetical order.
